alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 9:39AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Warren, central Hancock and northern Glascock Counties through 1045 AM EDT... At 938 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was centered near Sparta, moving east at 45 mph. Very heavy rainfall was also occurring. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary minor flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Warrenton, Sparta, Norwood, Camak, Springfield, Shoals, Devereux, Jewell, Beall Springs, Mayfield, Powelton, Reese, Mesena, Shoulderbone, Bastonville and Culverton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM EDT for east central Georgia. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM EDT for east central Georgia.
